Two flat mirrors, Mirror <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> and Mirror <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> are located near each other, as shown in the figure. Mirror <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> is oriented at a small but nonnegligible angle from the vertical, as indicated, while Mirror <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> is oriented vertically. A light ray travels to the left through a small hole in Mirror <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> and is initially perpendicular to Mirror <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> as shown. The light ray then has the following interactions with the two mirrors.

First, the ray is incident on Mirror <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> with an angle of incidence <math alttext="theta sub X 1, end sub" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>θ</mi><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></math> as measured from the normal to the surface of Mirror <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math>, and is then reflected from Mirror <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> toward Mirror <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>.

Next, the ray is incident on Mirror <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> with an angle of incidence <math alttext="theta sub Y 1, end sub" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>θ</mi><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></math> as measured from the normal to the surface of Mirror <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>, and is then reflected from Mirror <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> back toward Mirror <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math>.

Finally, the ray is incident on Mirror <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> for a second time, with an angle of incidence <math alttext="theta sub X 2, end sub" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>θ</mi><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math>, and is again reflected from Mirror <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math>.

Which of the following correctly ranks the angles of incidence <math alttext="theta sub X 1, end sub" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>θ</mi><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></math>, <math alttext="theta sub Y 1, end sub" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>θ</mi><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></math>, and <math alttext="theta sub X 2, end sub" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>θ</mi><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math> ?
